body_content.explanation: a small area that is different in some way from the area that surrounds it:
examples: Our dog has a black patch on his back.
The hotel walls were covered in damp patches.
There were lots of icy patches on the road this morning.
This story is good in patches (= some parts are good), but I wouldn't really recommend it.

body_content.explanation: a local area within which someone works:
examples: He's been working as a policeman on the same patch for 20 years.

body_content.explanation: a small piece of material sewn or stuck over something to cover it:
examples: I'll have to sew a patch onto these jeans - they're ripped at the knee.

body_content.explanation: a small piece of cloth with words or a picture on it, that can be sewn onto clothes to show who you are, your rank, that you are a member of a particular group or organization, etc.:
examples: a shirt with a US flag patch sewn onto the right shoulder
His black jacket has a black-and-silver patch bearing the school's Latin motto.

body_content.explanation: a small piece of material that can be stuck to the skin, from which particular substances can be absorbed into the body:
examples: Some people wear nicotine patches to help them give up smoking.

body_content.explanation: a small computer program that can be added to an existing program in order to make the existing program work as it should:
examples: I downloaded a patch from their website.

body_content.explanation: to connect electronic or phone equipment to a system
to put a patch on something
to solve a problem that a computer system or program has:
examples: They issued an update to patch the bug.
We need to identify and patch vulnerabilities in internet security.
